DataElement.preferredName: SF-36 Questionnaire Mental Component Summary Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric Mental Component Summary (MCS) score from the SF-36 Health Survey, a 36-question survey for measuring health status and outcomes from the patient's point of view.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Reference to the Mental Component Summary of the SF-36 Health Survey, a 36-question survey for measuring health status and outcomes from the patient's point of view.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: No value exists.:No value exists.:A 36 question survey for measuring health status and outcomes from the patient's point of view. Designed for use in surveys of general and specific populations, health policy evaluations, and clinical practice and research. Measures 8 health concepts: 1) Limitations in physical activities because of health problems, 2) Limitations in usual role activities because of physical health problems, 3) Bodily pain, 4) General health perceptions, 5) Vitality (energy and fatigue), 6) Limitations in social activities because of physical or emotional problems, 7) Limitations in usual role activities because of emotional problems, 8) Mental health (psychological distress and well-being). (from Medical Outcomes Trust)

Concepts.definition: A 36 question survey for measuring health status and outcomes from the patient's point of view. Designed for use in surveys of general and specific populations, health policy evaluations, and clinical practice and research. Measures 8 health concepts: 1) Limitations in physical activities because of health problems, 2) Limitations in usual role activities because of physical health problems, 3) Bodily pain, 4) General health perceptions, 5) Vitality (energy and fatigue), 6) Limitations in social activities because of physical or emotional problems, 7) Limitations in usual role activities because of emotional problems, 8) Mental health (psychological distress and well-being). (from Medical Outcomes Trust)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric score on a psychometric questionnaire or survey formatted to two decimal places.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
